trans-unit.source: Represents part of an output-cache entry that is stored in memory.
The output-cache response in a <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object is stored in memory as an array of bytes.
The array can contain all or part of an output-cache response.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement"></xref> class.
The value of `buffer` must not be `null`, although it can be a zero-length array.
An array of bytes that contains a part of an output-cache response.
The size of the array in buffer.
buffer is `null`.
length is less than zero or greater than the size of buffer.
Gets an array that contains all or part of an output-cache response.
The value of <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> property must not be `null`, although it can be a zero-length array.
If <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A>property is `null`, the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> constructor throws an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException>.
If the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Length%2A> property is less than zero or greater than the size of the value of <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A>property.
An array of byte objects.
Gets the size of the array that is referenced by the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer"></xref> property.
A <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object that is created by ASP.NET is a fixed-size memory buffer that is created from a pool of memory buffers.
As a result, the contents of a <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement> object often do not completely fill the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array.
Typically only a part of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array will contain response data.

Therefore, providers that serialize the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array directly (instead of serializing the complete type that is being stored in the output cache) must use the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Length%2A> property to determine how much of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.MemoryResponseElement.Buffer%2A> array must be stored.
The size of the array.
